newsitem.title: ALBANIA: First Western airliner in 11 days lands in Tirana.
newsitem.headline: First Western airliner in 11 days lands in Tirana.

text.p: Albania's main link with the outside world was restored on Monday when the first scheduled flight landed at Tirana airport since it was closed 11 days ago as armed turmoil swept the country.
An Austrian Airlines jet flew into the Albanian capital, the most visible sign yet that the country is returning to normal after weeks of chaos.
The Albanian authorities declared the airport officially open for business last week, but no scheduled flights have come in or out until now.

Although the country has calmed down after days of anarchy last week following the mass looting of weapons from army depots, the knowledge that thousands of arms are in private hands is still a cause for concern, particularly for airlines.
Shortly before the arrival of the Austrian airliner an Italian air force Hercules transport plane arrived at the airport with six tonnes of emergency medical aid.
